content.title: PM POSHAN - Prime Minister's Overarching Scheme For Holistic Nourishment
content.department: Department of School Education & Literacy, Ministry of Education
content.beneficiary: Children studying in Government and Government-aided schools
content.details: PM POSHAN is a centrally sponsored scheme that provides one hot cooked meal to children studying in Government and Government-aided schools across the country. The scheme aims to improve the nutritional status of eligible children and encourage regular school attendance.
benefits: Nutrition norm per child per day: Primary - Calorie – 450; Protein - 12 gms; Upper Primary - Calorie – 700; Protein - 20 gms.
Food norms per child per day: Primary - Food grains - 100 gms; Pulses - 20 gms; Vegetables - 50 gms; Oil & fat - 5 gms; Upper Primary - Food grains - 150 gms; Pulses - 30 gms; Vegetables - 75 gms.
eligibility: The applicant must be a citizen of India.
The applicant must be studying in a Primary or Upper Primary class (Class 1st to Class 8th) in a Government or a Government-aided school.
content.application_process: Offline. There is no application process for this scheme.

faqs.question: Are there any FAQs available for this scheme?
faqs.answer: No FAQs available for this Scheme.
